hackathon-description-text: Devpost is being used for our submission system. The "registration" for this event on DevPost is separate from your registration at sbhacks.com. You must be registered and checked in with our sbhacks.com (MyMLH) system in order for your registration and submission to count on DevPost.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Professor of Computer Science, UC Santa Barbara
UCSB Technology Management Program, Partner of Rincon Venture Partners
Professor of Computer Science, UC Santa Barbara

hackathon-eligibility: Participants must be students or have graduated college within the past year.
hackathon-rules:
The rules here are dictated by each challenge that you apply for, but there is one general rule:
You cannot submit a codebase that you have worked before the evening of January 20th.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Audio Engine A2+ Powered Speakers for each team member (Probably the best desktop speakers you can buy! Our set has been playing the event music!) OR $800 Cash
$100 Amazon gift cards for each team member
$50 Amazon gift cards for each team member
IBM Watson IoT Platform is a managed, cloud-hosted service designed to make it simple to derive value from your Internet of Things devices.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of Watson IoT platform on IBM Bluemix

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use Esri's developer platform to create something unique and wow the Esri representatives. Check out their platform for a free Esri developer subscription!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of Esri Developer Platform

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: This challenge is provided by Invoca. The best use of Ruby for their hackathon submission will be awarded with the prize
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: The best use of Ruby in a project by Invoca

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Most complex use of AWS will claim the prize!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS (MLH)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Ask the MLH Table for a promo URL to claim a free domain! Check out domain.com. Bring creativity!

Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment. Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. The best hack that fights online harrassment wins.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best aerospace related hack by Lockheed Martin
